data.text:
I've broken a couple - always on the rear wheel, where you can't quite get at them without removing the cassette/freewheel. In both cases, I managed to get to a bike shop before damaging the wheel. I think the best option is to grab yourself a FiberFix Emergency Spoke Repair Kit and learn to use it. I've been carrying one for several years now and still haven't broken another spoke, so I can't coach you through it, but I've only heard good things about this kit. https://www.amazon.com/FiberFix-Emergency-Spoke-Replacement-Kit/dp/B001GSMQZC
